meanings.definition: A yearly publication containing a calendar for the coming year, predictions of the times and movements of the sun, moon, and stars, and other related information.
meanings.sent1: I always check my almanacks to know when the next full moon will be.
meanings.sent2: The almanacks on the shelf help me plan my gardening schedule.
meanings.sent3: My almanacks predicted a sunny day, but it rained cats and dogs instead!
meanings.sent4: Her almanacks were like a crystal ball, revealing the secrets of the sky.
meanings.sent5: The almanacks whispered the mysteries of the universe to those who listened.

meanings.definition: A book or table containing a calendar of days, weeks, and months, to which astronomical data and various statistics are often added.
meanings.sent1: Grandma's almanacks have weather predictions for every month.
meanings.sent2: I keep my almanacks handy to track important dates and celestial events.
meanings.sent3: The almanacks on the desk seemed to have a mind of their own, flipping pages by themselves!
meanings.sent4: The almanacks were a treasure trove of time, holding the past and future within their pages.
meanings.sent5: In the library, the almanacks stood like guardians of time, watching over the knowledge within.
